title: Reinforcement Learning Aided Sequential Optimization for Unsignalized Intersection Management of Robot Traffic
abstract: arXiv:2302.05082v3 Announce Type: replace  Abstract: We consider the problem of optimal unsignalized intersection management, wherein we seek to obtain safe and optimal trajectories, for a set of robots that arrive randomly and continually. This problem involves repeatedly solving a mixed integer program (with robot acceleration trajectories as decision variables) with different parameters, for which the computation time using a naive optimization algorithm scales exponentially with the number of robots and lanes. Hence, such an approach is not suitable for real-time implementation. In this paper, we propose a solution framework that combines learning and sequential optimization. In particular, we propose an algorithm for learning a shared policy that given the traffic state information, determines the crossing order of the robots.
